body.p: To his Excellency The Governor of Kentucky --

Your petitioner Elijah B. Adams states that at the May Term 1862 of the Washington Circuit Court -- he was fined sixty dollars upon a charge of Keeping a Tipling House The facts of the case were these -- Your petitioner is a farmer and raised a quantity of corn -- he had no distillery of his own and desiring to have his corn made into whisky he hired a neighbor who ran a distillery to take his corn and make it into whisky on the shares -- one half for the other -- which ^he^ did This whisky your Petitioner took to his residence -- and sold out to several of the neighbors by the quart -- As he thought and believed he had a right under the law of the State permitting distillers of their own grain to sell the Whisky make from it in quantities not less Than a quart without a License to do so -- This was his offense He had no desire or purpose to violate the law. Wherefore he asks -- your Excellency to remit said fine.
Sworn to before me by Elijah B. Adams the 11th June 1862
We the undersigned citizens of Washington County beleive the statements of this petition are true, And join the the prayer thereof for the remission of the fine --

Richd J. Brown
